network_overview: The trace shows long-lived control-plane sessions only: 5G N4 PFCP between SMF-UPF, 4G S6a Diameter MME-HSS, and GTP-C path management. No user-plane GTP-U bursts, no SIP/RTP, and no failure codes beyond GTP-C "Unknown Cause 128" are present.

observations.finding: All monitored control-plane sessions remained stable for ~37 h with low, steady message rates (PFCP 0.04 pkt/s, GTP-C 0.01 pkt/s).
observations.evidence: PFCP Msg-51/53/55/57 all answered with 'Request Accepted'; Diameter Cmd-272 consistently returned 2001/2002; no teardown messages seen.

observations.finding: 44 GTP-C Echo-Response messages carried an unusual cause value 'Unknown Cause 128' instead of the normal 'Request Accepted'.
observations.evidence: GTP-Msg-0x13 (Echo-Response) listed 44 occurrences with top_cause 'Unknown Cause 128'.

root_causes.description: Every observed GTP-C Echo-Response (Msg-type 0x13) returned cause code 128, which is not assigned in 3GPP TS 29.060. This indicates a vendor-specific or outdated node generating the replies, but since Echo-Requests were answered the path is functionally intact.
root_causes.impact: No user impact visible; risk of mis-interpretation by peer node or monitoring tools.
evidence_refs: No Echo-Request timeouts or retransmissions seen

inconclusive_aspects.reason: GTP-U tunnels are listed but no user-plane packets captured; capture point sits on control links only.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: Mirror the S1-U, S5-U, or N3 interface to verify GTP-U encapsulation and throughput.

inconclusive_aspects.reason: No SIP, RTP, or SDP messages present in the trace.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: Capture on P-CSCF/SBC or user-plane to observe SIP registration, INVITE, and RTP streams.

inconclusive_aspects.reason: Counters show 0 % success_rate for all Diameter commands although 2001/2002 answers are visible; metric calculation appears incorrect or filtered.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: Validate KPI script against raw answer-bit setting in Diameter header.

recommendations.action: Upgrade or patch the GTP-C entity sending 'Unknown Cause 128' to use standard cause 'Request Accepted' (value 16) for Echo-Response.
recommendations.rationale: Removes ambiguity and prevents potential interoperability issues with future peers or monitoring systems.

recommendations.action: Enable GTP-U mirroring on N3/S1-U for short window to confirm user-plane forwarding matches the control-plane tunnel table signalled by PFCP and GTP-C.
recommendations.rationale: Ensures actual data can traverse the established bearers despite healthy control-plane.

session_analysis.signaling_health: All observed PFCP, Diameter, and GTP-C sessions stayed up with normal request/response patterns; no protocol errors or timeouts detected.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: Not observable at this capture point.
session_analysis.voice_quality: Not observable at this capture point.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: Control-plane shows stable bearer contexts (PFCP established, GTP-C tunnels exist) but absence of GTP-U packets prevents confirmation of successful data delivery.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant SMF
    participant UPF
    participant MME
    participant HSS
    participant SGW
    Note over SMF,UPF: N4 (PFCP)
    SMF->>UPF: Msg-50 (Establish req)
    UPF->>SMF: Msg-51 (Accept)
    SMF->>UPF: Msg-52 (Modify req)
    UPF->>SMF: Msg-53 (Accept)
    Note over MME,HSS: S6a (Diameter)
    MME->>HSS: Cmd-272 (Update-Location)
    HSS->>MME: Cmd-272 2001 OK
    Note over SGW,SGW: GTP-C Path
    SGW->>SGW: Msg-0x12 Echo-Request
    SGW->>SGW: Msg-0x13 Echo-Response (Cause 128)
